name: Clean and spacious 2 bed apartment
summary: My home is clean and quiet. It's a short 25-35 min drive to Downtown Boston (public transportation is about 45 minutes) and only 36 minutes to the Wrentham outlets. You'll love my place because of the close proximity (15 minute bus ride)to the Forest Hills station which will take you right into Downtown Boston. Harvard University (Cambridge) is 7.9 miles away and takes 26 minutes by car and 57 minutes by subway. My place is good for guests who want a place to stay that is outside of the city.
space: This apartment is on the first floor and has two good size bedrooms, a comfortable living room with a pull out couch, a private bathroom, coin-operated laundry access in the basement, off street tandem parking, and a fully functional kitchen. There is free WiFi, a flat screen t.v., a DVD player, a back porch, a large backyard and small appliances like a slow cooker, rice cooker, microwave and blender. All guests will be required to clean these small appliances if you use them.  It will not be part of the cleaning fee that is charged.  It is close to major colleges, teaching hospitals and a short commute to Downtown  Boston. This is the perfect place to stay if attending graduations, weddings, sporting events, the Boston marathon or coming to sightsee.  George Wright golf course is also a five minute drive away! neighborhood_overview: Roslindale is a wonderful quaint little town filled with delicious restaurants, and bakeries.  There is a Farmer's Market in the Village and music entertainment during the summer months.
notes: This is a very quiet neighborhood. Please be quiet especially at night so the neighbors are not disturbed.  This is not a place for loud music or any parties.  Please let me know if you do not know how to use the thermostat and never turn the knobs on the radiators. Please do not misplace the remote control for the air conditioner. Please take your shoes off in the foyer and wear slippers/ indoor shoes inside. Please put your recyclables in the blue trash Barrell and your trash in the black trash barrel. Please do not spray anything on or near the tv screen. If you need an iron or ironing board just let me know. You will need 2.50 in quarters to do one wash and 2.00 in quarters to dry. If you need quarters I can provide them for you. Thank you!
transit: My place is very close to public transportation.  Three buses are a 5 minute walk from the house.  These buses will take you to Forest Hills in approximately 15-20 minutes. From there you will take the Orange Line for a quick trip to Downtown Boston. You may also walk 15 minutes or take a short bus ride to the Bellevue stop and take the commuter rail into downtown. This option costs more money but is a much faster way to get to downtown.
access: Guests will have access to a private two bedroom apartment on the first floor that has a Living room with a pull out couch and flat screen t.v, DVD player, free wifi, a master bedroom with a comfortable full size bed and a second bedroom with 2 twin size beds, a private bathroom, full eat in kitchen with small appliances that you will need to clean if you use them,  parking and a washer/dryer in the basement. There will be extra toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags in the back hallway on the shelf.  Please take them when you need them. Please help yourself to any snacks, tea or coffee in the cabinets.  There is also a back porch and a large backyard.
interaction: I love to meet new people. I am available and will interact with my guests as much as they are interested. If they want space then that's fine with me too. I can provide a detailed description of the neighborhood and help with any directions or suggestions you may need or want.
house_rules: Please clean up after yourself in both the kitchen (including small appliances) and bathroom. Please respect my neighbors and other people living in the building by keeping the noise level to a minimum especially at night. Thank you and enjoy your stay!
host_about: Hi! I am a certified ESL teacher who teaches first grade. I love taking yoga classes, seeing movies, and dancing.  I am very excited to be your host and want to make your trip as fun as possible.  I look forward to meeting you!

summary: Stay in a charming 1916 American Four-Square house in the the new hip section of Boston. Perfect for a family! Quiet, safe and convenient location. Free off-street parking, large fenced yard, and wifi. Walk across the tree-lined street to Harvard's 200 acre Arboretum. Walk the other direction to "Roslindale Square" for coffee shops, groceries, bakeries, and a weekend farmer's market. Catch the commuter rail and you'll be in downtown Boston in 15 minutes. Two playgrounds within walking distance.

So it's nice & safe.  * Returning late at night???......Not a problem! * A recent guest finished her shift at 2am and would come home safely every morning. No problem whatsoever! * Tons of "everything" around!!! * Reliable bus 32 picks up a couple of houses down for the 5 min ride to the T Station and returns home right in front of the house! Pretty incredible! Nice & convenient.  - Local Rozzy Sq and all its stores, restaurants, banks, etc etc .  - 3 Strip Malls w/ CVS, Walgreens, Stop& Shop, American Basket grocery stores, Dental office etc etc. - Pizza, McDonalds, KFC & similar foods all close by - New Exercise Gym - Sacred Ht Catholic Church & other denominations close by. - US Post office. notes: Practical & Efficiency kitchen space. Two Red Hot ceramic stove burners suitable for making meals fulfilling Airbnb's requirement.  * Flatware, plates, pots and pans are all provided.  * Microwave Convection Oven provided for roasting, baking etc. * Several appliances available along with Organic food spices provided.  * Coffee & Tea K cups provided. * Your room remote will work on the kitchen TV. * Ample street parking in front of house. Street Cleaning on Mondays so would need to park on opposite side from Sunday 12am - 7am. * Wi-fi information should open up under "guest resources" upon booking confirmation. Oh & On the last day, you do not need to strip the bed, however if you could leave the rest of the room as close to how you met it, would be greatly appreciated:)

name: Warm and serene home in Roslindale part of Boston
summary: You are welcome in my home.  I have one bedroom available for 1-2 guests, with a full size bed, plenty of closet and drawer space, two full shared bathrooms and on street parking. I am 2 blocks from bus line and 10 minute bus ride to subway. I am also close to commuter rail to downtown. I welcome guests in my comfortable living room and my enclosed front porch. I also have a landscaped back patio and garden, which I share with you.  My two cats, Sophie and Suki, will enjoy your presence!
space: I treasure my home and have tried to make it as welcoming as possible.  I love to garden and to help things grow.

Roslindale prides itself on its diversity.  There are a variety of restaurants and stores, with Greek, Italian and Spanish food.   Downtown Boston is easily accessible by public transport, with all its museums, universities, Fenway Park, shops and restaurants.
notes: I have a 20 year old son who has a room in the house.  He is not always here but you may see him on occasion.

name: Spacious and Quiet Apartment in Roslindale
summary: The apartment resides in Roslindale, a cute neighborhood of Boston. You get access to the city of Boston but also the quaint, quiet, suburban feel. Roslindale square is a 10 minute walk to great restaurants, yoga, unique shops, and weekly farmers market. You also have access to the Arnold Arboretum, a 265- acre park that is part of Boston's Emerald Necklace. Just one block away from the bus stop that takes you to Forrest Hills T line station. Plus free street parking.

The house is 100+ years old with lots of beautiful detail but also modern appliances and updates.  The master suite was recently updated with a big adjoining walk-in closet and bright bathroom. We're 5 mins from Roslindale village with it's restaurants and kids-oriented summer farmer's market, and across the street from a big park and new playground (with splash). Perfect for families!

name: Escape Noisy City in Comfy/Spacious Private Room
summary: A newly furnished and renovated room in a cozy, spacious 3 bedroom apartment. Nestled in a quiet and friendly neighborhood. The listing is a 30 minute drive to Downtown Boston. Less than a minute walk from the bus stop, you can take public transportation into the heart of the city (a 35-45 minute commute). If you're looking to escape the noisy and busy Downtown scene, this neighboring town has many local shops and great restaurants to visit; you'll feel like a true local!
space: The space is fully renovated, yet it still has that relaxing home charm. The area is a very quiet family neighborhood. Within walking distance there are various parks and local shops; you can find various restaurants as well as local delis and grocery shops. Be sure to ask me for my top picks!

neighborhood_overview: Pleasant neighborhood.  Mixed cultures.  The recently Late Mayor Menino of Boston lived down the road for many many years.  Not too far from the Police Station.  A recent guest worked the late shift and would return every morning at 2! There never was an issue and she never expressed anxiety! That's the neighborhood for you! Nice & Safe! Also, Tons of "everything" around!  Reliable bus #32 picks up from a couple of houses to the right and upon return from town drops passengers off right in front of the house across the street....very convenient.  Some local stores are  - Local Rozzy Sq and all its Stores, Restaurants, banks etc etc - 3 Strip Malls w/ CVS, Walgreens, Stop & Shop, American Basket grocery stores, Dental office etc etc. - Pizza, McDonalds, KFC & similar foods all close by. - New Exercise Gym - Sacred Ht Catholic Church & other denominations close by. - US Post office. RMV Close to  Arnold Arboretum Franklin Park Zoo Samuel Adams Brewery
notes: Practical & Efficiency Kitchen space.  Two Red Hot ceramic stove burners adequate for making meals fulfilling Airbnb's requirement.  Flatware, plates, pots and pans are all provided.  Microwave Convection Oven provided for roasting, baking etc.  Several appliances available along with Organic food spices provided.  Coffee & Tea K cups provided. Ample street parking in front of the house. Street Cleaning on Mondays between Sunday 12 midnight - Monday 7am so park on the opposite side of road.  Wi-fi information should open up under "guest resources " upon booking confirmation. If not please let me know so I can provide you the information. There's a small wall around the edge of the room; great for placing regular items on, but will break through if you SIT, lean or stand on it, so please be mindful. * Oh & On the last day, you do not need to strip the bed. However, if you could leave the rest of the room as close to how you met it, would be greatly appreciated:)
transit: -Bus #32 stops a few doors from the house. - Very short ride to Forest Hill T station. -Bus #32 stops upon return, directly in front of the house across the street. Buses - Over 20. Buses leave from Forest Hills. Subway- Orange line.  - Forest hill Trains- Needham line Bus #32 goes past the CVS / Dunkin Donut mall but a short walk is required to reach the Walgreens mall and the 3rd mall.  ZipCar & Uber are also options.
access: - GUESTS HAVE SEPARATE ENTRANCE. Pop in and out as you please!  -Access into the house thru a coded entry.  -Code will be sent to you upon arrival in town along with some extra pertinent information to help make your stay relaxed and enjoyable.  -Access to Private Room.  Share Practical Efficiency kitchen w/ Dining table.  SHARE BATHROOM.
interaction: Pretty independent living. I find most guests prefer this. I won't be in your business or hovering around! but I'll be available in person, by phone, text, email whenever needed. I do check up on guests periodically to make sure all is well & then I allow them their space. They are encouraged and free to contact me at anytime. I socialize as much as they allow!
house_rules: * No smoking * No noise or loud music after 9 pm  * House Quiet time 10pm - 6pm * No drunken behavior  * No Illegal Drug Use anywhere on the property. * No unauthorized guests staying overnight. * Be Mindful of others * Please Clean up after yourself... as close to Pristine as possible!  * A $250 deposit is listed but will NOT be charged at booking. It is only to be used in the event of a property damage claim.  Thank you.

name: Cozy 1 bedroom apartment in Roslindale
summary: Cozy 1 bedroom basement apartment with private entrance located near Roslindale Village. If you're looking for a clean, safe, and convenient place to rest your head then you have found your place.   Whether you are visiting Boston for business or pleasure, this location offers easy access to a variety of public transportation options and free street parking for those who prefer to drive.
space: There is a full size bed in the bedroom and the sofa in the living room can also accommodate a guest.  The apartment has furniture (as seen in photos), a TV with cable and WI-FI.  The Kitchen has all the necessary utensils to make and serve a home meal. Coffee, basic spices, coffee creamer, towels and linens are provided. No in house laundry though there is a laundromat just down the street. I want to be extremely transparent and state that the amenities are minimal and basic, which is why the rate is lower than other similar listings. Hopefully you'll be out enjoying the city and you just need an inviting place to rest your head at night. Please bring your own toiletries.

neighborhood_overview: Roslindale is a primarily residential neighborhood of Boston, bordered by Jamaica Plain, Hyde Park, West Roxbury and Mattapan. It is a short walk to the Arnold Arboretum, the Stony Brook Reservation and a variety of other parks and recreational venues. Roslindale Village has a Farmer’s Market every Saturday from 9a-1p where you can shop, eat and enjoy the day with the locals. Because of our location, you will soon discover that we are very centrally located to a wide variety of shopping options, from Boston to Dedham the choices are endless. We are around 4.5 miles to the Longwood Medical area and about 1.5 miles to the Faulkner hospital, Jewish Rehab and Spaulding rehab.
notes: There is Central Heat and Air Conditioning WI-FI Cable
transit: Parking: Ample street parking.   Public transportation available in Roslindale includes:  Orange Line @ Forest Hills, Commuter Rail train in Roslindale Village. Bus routes from Forest Hills Station to get to Walworth Street are the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and 37.
access: Guests have access to a free street parking.  Guests have a private entrance to the apartment on the right side of the house.
interaction: Your host John or his partner Prakash will be here to great guest's. Any unforeseen issues will be communicated directly to the guest's. Check-in time is 3pm and Check-out time is 12pm, however please message me if you need different accommodation as there might be some flexibility for check-in/check-out time.

name: Rozzie Room
summary: Nice room with queen bed, dresser, closet and desk.
space: NA
description: Nice room with queen bed, dresser, closet and desk. You have a private bedroom, shared half bath on first floor and shower in basement, also have shared access to the kitchen. I am available for help when I'm home, usually after 8 p.m. or by cell phone (although my cell service at work can be spotty - sometimes it works, other times not so much). Very quiet, eclectic neighborhood.  Lots of stores, restaurants, etc. within walking distance. The Arnold Arboretum and Fallon Field are also only a short walk away. The closest public transportation is a bus stop at the corner of the street to Forest Hills (bus lines 35, 36 and 37).  The commuter rail to South Station is about 1/2 mile away.  I have a driveway where I can accommodate 1 additional car, but we'd have to coordinate who needs to get in/out, etc.  There is also street parking available. The wireless password is on the side of the cable box on top of the file cabinet in the room.

name: cute and cozy 3rd floor apt
summary: My home is clean and quiet. It's a short 25-35 minute drive to Downtown Boston (public transportation is about 45 minutes) and only 36 minutes to the Wrentham outlets. You'll love my place because of the close proximity (15 min bus ride)to the Forest Hills station which will take you right into Downtown Boston. Harvard University (Cambridge) is 7.9 miles away and is 26 minutes by car and 57 minutes by subway. My place is good for guests who want a place to stay that is outside of the city.
space: This apartment is on the third floor. There is no elevator so you will have to walk up two flights of stairs.  It has two good size bedrooms, a comfortable living room with a futon couch, a private bathroom, coin-operated laundry access in the basement, off street tandem parking, and a fully functional kitchen. There is free WiFi, a small flat screen t.v., a back porch, a large backyard. It is close to major colleges, teaching hospitals and a short commute to Downtown Boston. This is the perfect place to stay if attending graduations, weddings, sporting events, the Boston marathon or coming to sightsee. George Wright golf course is also a five minute drive away! Legacy Place is about a ten minute drive away and has many high end stores for shopping, plenty of delicious restaurants, Kings Bowling Alley and a movie theatre. You can also access Legacy Place by bus. Wrentham outlets is only 36 minutes away.

neighborhood_overview: Roslindale is a wonderful quaint little town filled with delicious restaurants, and bakeries. There is a Farmer's Market in the Village and music entertainment during the summer months.
notes: This is a very quiet neighborhood. Please be quiet especially at night so the neighbors are not disturbed. This is not a place for loud music or any parties.  Please let me know if you do not know how to use the thermostat and never turn the knobs on the radiators. Please do not misplace the remote control for the television. Please take your shoes off in the foyer and wear slippers/ indoor shoes upstairs and inside. Please put your recyclables in the blue trash barrell and your trash in the black trash barrel. Please do not spray anything on or near the t.v. screen. If you need an iron or ironing board it is located in the back hallway on the first floor. Please return it when finished. You will need 2.50 in quarters to do one wash and 2.00 in quarters to dry. If you need quarters I can provide them for you. Thank you!
transit: My place is very close to public transportation. Three buses are a 5 minute walk from the house. These buses will take you to Forest Hills in approximately 15-20 minutes. From there you will take the Orange Line for a quick trip to Downtown Boston. You may also walk 15 minutes (or take a quick bus ride) to the Bellevue stop(purple line)  in Roslindale Village and take the commuter rail into downtown. Cambridge is 7.9 miles away and approximately 26 minutes by car and 57 minutes by subway.
access: Guests will have access to a private two bedroom apartment on the third floor that has a Living room with a futon couch and small flat screen t.v, free wifi, a master bedroom with a comfortable full size bed and a second bedroom with 2 twin size beds, a private bathroom, parking and a washer/dryer in the basement. There will be extra toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags in the back hallway on the shelf. Please take them when you need them. Please help yourself to any snacks, tea or coffee in the cabinets. There is also a back porch on the FIRST floor and a large backyard.  Please do not use the porch on the third floor or the closet in the back hallway outside of your main back door.
interaction: I love to meet new people. I am available and will interact with my guests as much as they are interested. If they want space then that's fine with me too. I can provide a detailed description of the neighborhood and help with any directions or suggestions you may need or want.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Hi! I am a certified ESL teacher who teaches first grade. I love taking yoga classes, seeing movies, and dancing.  I am very excited to be your host and want to make your trip as fun as possible.  I look forward to meeting you!

name: Comfort and convenience in Boston with parking
summary: Guests will find this comfortable home the perfect place to rest and refresh while visiting Boston.  The guestroom is bright and spacious with T.V. wireless internet and the home is a short walk to public transportation.
space: The house is a Queen Anne Victorian, built in 1884.
description: Guests will find this comfortable home the perfect place to rest and refresh while visiting Boston.  The guestroom is bright and spacious with T.V. wireless internet and the home is a short walk to public transportation. The house is a Queen Anne Victorian, built in 1884. In addition to their own private bedroom,  guests are welcome to use the front porch, back deck area as well as the backyard. Offstreet parking is also available for all guests. Host is available to offer help throughout stay. My home is within walking distance of public transportation  as well as a variety of restaurants, drugstores, food markets, specialty shops and laundromats. Private parking is available to all guests and public transportation is a short walk away.  Taxicabs, Uber and Lyft are also easily arranged. The full bath on the guest floor is exclusively for Airbnb guests and is only used by me when guests are not home.

Less than a minute walk from the bus stop, you can take public transportation into the heart of the city (a 35-45 minute commute). If you're looking to escape the noisy and busy Downtown scene, this neighboring town has many local shops and great restaurants to visit; you'll feel like a true local!

name: Newly Renovated Spacious Apartment in Boston
summary: Newly renovated, large, spacious, sunny 2 bedroom apartment. Quiet, residential, family friendly neighborhood 6 miles from downtown Boston.  A 5 minutes walk to the train or bus that takes you directly into town. Ideally located in the Roslindale Village section of Boston, my place is just a short train ride away from most area attractions. It's also a short stroll to trendy restaurants and shops, commuter rail and the Arnold Arboretum. All within a 5 minute walk from my front door.
space: Eat-in kitchen with granite counter tops and stainless steel appliances, including refrigerator with ice and water, dishwasher, gas stove, toaster and microwave. Pots, pans, coffee pot, as well as all dishes and all utensils necessary. Granite topped kitchen island with adjacent eat-in dining area. Two newly renovated bathrooms, shower, tub and double vanity. Each spacious bedroom has a queen size bed, large closets, sitting area and ample room.  There is also a couch that can be converted to a full size bed in the living room. Free washer and dryer in the unit available for use.
description: Newly renovated, large, spacious, sunny 2 bedroom apartment. Quiet, residential, family friendly neighborhood 6 miles from downtown Boston.  A 5 minutes walk to the train or bus that takes you directly into town. Ideally located in the Roslindale Village section of Boston, my place is just a short train ride away from most area attractions. It's also a short stroll to trendy restaurants and shops, commuter rail and the Arnold Arboretum. All within a 5 minute walk from my front door. Eat-in kitchen with granite counter tops and stainless steel appliances, including refrigerator with ice and water, dishwasher, gas stove, toaster and microwave. Pots, pans, coffee pot, as well as all dishes and all utensils necessary. Granite topped kitchen island with adjacent eat-in dining area. Two newly renovated bathrooms, shower, tub and double vanity. Each spacious bedroom has a queen size bed, large closets, sitting area and ample room.  There is also a couch that can be converted to a full size be
neighborhood_overview: My apartment is located in the Roslindale Village section of Boston. 5 miles from Museum of Fine Arts; 7 miles from Public Gardens; 6 miles from Harvard University in Cambridge 6 miles from Fenway Park; 5 miles to Longwood Medical area, Boston Children’s Hospital and Harvard Medical School The location and its accessibility make it great for travelers or couples looking to be in the heart of the city in minutes. Quick access to the commuter rail and MBTA train station makes for easy travel throughout city.
notes: Roslindale is a residential neighborhood of Boston. It is served by the Commuter Rail line, several bus lines and the Orange Line subway. Roslindale is 6 miles south-southwest of downtown Boston. Here you will find the Arnold Arboretum. It's a 281-acre park that’s part of Boston’s Emerald Necklace.  The Arnold Arboretum is the oldest public park in the country, established in 1872 and maintained by Harvard University. Roslindale Village is a vibrant shopping and dining area. Enjoy unique shops, bistros, and wireless internet. Downtown is just a quick ride away on the MBTA Orange Line and Commuter Rail. Roslindale Village is a thriving commercial hub, with free public wifi in Adams Park, and a fabulous Farmers Market. Perfect for a relaxing Boston getaway and easy access to most area attractions.
transit: Roslindale Village commuter rail stop is minutes from my front door. This train takes you into town in 10 minutes. The bus stop is also a 5 minute walk from my place. This bus takes you to Forest Hills station subway in 15 min. From there you take the subway which takes you into town in 15 minutes.  An Uber or Lyft takes you into town in 20 min.
access: The entire private first floor apartment with soaring 10 foot ceilings and hardwood floors throughout, spacious bedrooms, modern bath as well as modern comfortable furniture and amenities. Open concept comfortable living room with high ceilings, crown molding, and recessed lighting. Off street shared driveway is available for one car.
interaction: I am a phone call or text away. I am available to give you directions and recommendations anywhere is Boston, or anywhere else in Massachusetts.
house_rules: No smoking on premises, including front porch, back porch or decks. No visitors and unregistered guests at any time of the day/night. Ring video doorbell is installed at the front entrance of the house.  No pets. No parties. No loud noise after 11pm. No shoes in the house.
host_about: A life-long Bostonian.

summary: - Independent living! No curfews!  - NO uncomfortable mandatory socializing!  - NO watching channels that others want to watch! space: * On T & Bus line *  * The listing has been described too many times as a "cozy" home. neighborhood_overview: Pleasant neighborhood. Mixed cultures.  * The recently Late Mayor Menino of Boston lived down the road, past the Police Station. Nice & Safe. Returning late at night???......Not a problem!  * A recent guest worked the late shift and came home safely every morning at 2 !!. Not a single problem! * Tons of "everything" around!!! * Reliable bus #32 picks up from a couple of houses to my right and upon return from town,  drops passengers off right across the street from the house.... very convenient.
notes: Practical & Efficiency kitchen space.  Two Red Hot ceramic stove burners suitable for making meals fulfilling Airbnb's requirement. * Flatware, plates, pots and pans are all provided.  * Microwave Convection Oven provided for roasting, baking etc.  * Several appliances available along with Organic food spices provided. * Coffee & Tea K cups provided.  * Ample street parking in front of the house. Street cleaning on Mondays so would need to park on opposite side between Sunday 12 midnight - 7am Monday. * There is a small wall around the edge of the room, great for placing regular items on, but will break through if you SIT, lean or stand on it, so please be careful. * Wi-fi information should open up under "guest resources" upon booking confirmation. If not please let me know so I can provide you the information. * Outdoor Security light and cameras. * Oh & On the last day, you do not need to strip the bed, but if you could leave the rest of the room as close to how you met it, would be
transit: * Bus #32 a few houses down takes you to Orange line Forest Hill T Station in a little over 5mins.  * Over 20 buses & subway trains available to help you continue your journey.  * Upon return bus #32 drops you right across the street from the house.  * You can be taken to the CVS, Dunkin Donuts mall by this method but would have to walk the short distance to the Walgreens malls behind the house and the 3rd mall a short distance away.  * ZipCar & Uber are also options.
access: - GUESTS HAVE SEPARATE ENTRANCE. Not a single problem! * Tons of "everything" around!!! * Reliable bus #32 picks up from a couple of houses to my right and upon return from town,  drops passengers off right across the street from the house.... very convenient.
notes: Practical & Efficiency kitchen space.  Two Red Hot ceramic stove burners suitable for making meals fulfilling Airbnb's requirement. * Flatware, plates, pots and pans are all provided.  * Microwave Convection Oven provided for roasting, baking etc.  * Several appliances available along with Organic food spices provided. * Coffee & Tea K cups provided.  * Kitchen wares are Color Coded. More details will be provided upon arrival. * Your remote will work on the kitchen TV too. * Ample street parking in front of the house. Street cleaning on Mondays so would need to park on opposite side between 12am - 7am Sunday into Monday morning. * There is a small wall around the edge of the room, great for placing regular items on, but will break through if you SIT, lean or stand on it, so please be  mindful. * Wi-fi information should open up under "guest resources" upon booking confirmation. If not please let me know so I can provide you the information. * Outside Security lights & Cameras. * Oh & O
transit: * Bus #32 a few houses down takes you to Orange line Forest Hill T Station in a little over 5mins.  * Over 20 buses & subway trains available to help you continue your journey.  * Upon return bus #32 drops you right across the street from the house.  * You can be taken to the CVS, Dunkin Donuts mall by this method but would have to walk the short distance to the Walgreens malls behind the house and the 3rd mall a short distance away.  * ZipCar & Uber are also options.

summary: Fun, safe, diverse, quiet neighborhood accessible to downtown by a bus around the corner that takes you to Forest Hills station.  Free on-street parking.  This is a basement den with a private 3/4 bathroom ( shower, toilet, sink).  The sectional converts to a double  bed and attached single bed. Private TV. neighborhood_overview: I love the proximity to downtown, the neighborhood pride, safety, nice shops and restaurants within a 8-minute walk.  Roslindale is welcoming to all types of people.  The City website describes it:  "Once considered a "garden suburb" of Boston, today's residents of Roslindale are still attracted to the neighborhood's natural beauty. Locals walk and bike in the Arnold Arboretum, a 265-acre oasis that is part of Frederick Law Olmsted's Emerald Necklace.....Roslindale Village is the city's original Main Street district and now one of the city's most vibrant, featuring several bistros, unique shops, and wireless Internet access. The MBTA Orange Line and Commuter Rail provide commuters with easy access to downtown."
notes: The den is in the basement.
transit: On street parking is easy to get within a half block of the house. It is free and unrestricted. I am a three minute walk from the bus stop, where buses 35,, 36 or 37 will take you to Forest Hills station. Forest Hills station is on the Orange line of the Mbta and from there, you can get anywhere. I also sometimes use Uber and Lyft. One option also is to drive your car to Forest Hills station and park for six dollars all day. You can then take the subway in town.
access: Exclusive use of den/bedroom and bath - on a separate level in the home, access to first floor kitchen, half bath, and porches
interaction: I’m happy to help you with your plans and with questions about the neighborhood, Local attractions, and transportation. My room and bathroom are on a separate floor, so when you want privacy, you definitely  can have that as well.
house_rules: Please remove shoes. Please place used dishes in dishwasher.
host_about:
I recently retired from work in the school district. My two wonderful adult sons live in their own homes in Boston.  Camping, bicycling, music, reading, and quiet time with friends and family are what I enjoy.  I love going to church and being part of the church community. Boston is a great place to live and every day I am happy to be here!

My hosting style is "available" but not "hovering"!  Some people want to be completely on their own and others like a little connection and appreciate the host being available.  I am happy to accommodate your style.

name: Queen bedroom, private bath in Victorian Farmhouse
summary: Our home is a 3000-square-foot Victorian farmhouse built in 1900 in a quiet neighborhood  only a short walk from great restaurants, shopping, public transportation, and the Boston School of English. All inclusive pricing!  We do not charge cleaning, or other fees.
space: This is a comfortable room with private bath just off the kitchen on the first floor.  Guests sometimes congregate in the kitchen, especially in the mornings and evenings, so their might be good conversation happening right outside your door.  We've never had anyone comment that noise was an issue, and we do our best to keep things quiet in the kitchen.  We also have a white/ambient noisemaker in the room.
description: Our home is a 3000-square-foot Victorian farmhouse built in 1900 in a quiet neighborhood  only a short walk from great restaurants, shopping, public transportation, and the Boston School of English. All inclusive pricing!  We do not charge cleaning, or other fees. This is a comfortable room with private bath just off the kitchen on the first floor.  Guests sometimes congregate in the kitchen, especially in the mornings and evenings, so their might be good conversation happening right outside your door.  We've never had anyone comment that noise was an issue, and we do our best to keep things quiet in the kitchen.  We also have a white/ambient noisemaker in the room. Guests will have access to the first floor living room, dining room, and kitchen, and the second-floor laundry room. We are friendly and outgoing, and and will help you in any way that we can, but we will also give you your space. Roslindale is an up and coming neighborhood next door to Jamaica Plain, West Roxbury,   Brookl
neighborhood_overview: Roslindale is an up and coming neighborhood next door to Jamaica Plain, West Roxbury,   Brookline, and the 265-acre Arnold Arboretum.  The list of great restaurants in the square includes Birch Street Bistro, Delfino, 753 South, Shanti, and Sophia's Grotto.  Napper Tandy's is an Irish pub with reasonably-priced beer, excellent comfort food, and a pool hall.  Fornax is an amazing bakery, Effie's Kitchen Gyro is the place for Greek fare, and Blue Star Restaurant serves breakfast and lunch.  There's also Village Market, a full-service grocery store, Family Dollar, and Target, Subway, and, of course, Dunkin' Donuts.  All are easy walks from our home as are many other shops, salons, and stores, Bank of America, and the Boston School of English.
notes: We welcome guests with well-socialized canine companions. Parking may be available in our driveway, and there is almost always safe street parking on Poplar and Florence Streets. Smoking is allowed outside.
transit: The Roslindale Village Commuter Rail station (Needham Line) is a five-minute walk from the house, maybe six or seven minutes if you don't catch the lights right at Washington Street.  Buses to and from Forrest Hills T Station are a one-minute walk.  You can catch multiple buses to and from Forrest Hills, including the 34, the 34E, the 36, the 37, the 50, and the 51.
access: Guests will have access to the first floor living room, dining room, and kitchen, and the second-floor laundry room.
interaction: We are friendly and outgoing, and and will help you in any way that we can, but we will also give you your space.
house_rules: Quiet time after 10 pm.  Smoking is allowed outside.
host_name: Ken, Reema, Erik, Jim, And Rusty!
host_about:
We are a modern, chosen family consisting of me and my partners, Jim and Erik, Reema, the daughter of a guyanese friend, and canine ambassador, Rusty, our little five-year-old chihuahua/pomeranian rescue dog.  

We are all looking forward to sharing our home on AirBNB.  Jim is a clinical psychologist who works primarily with people with Autism Spectrum Disorder.  I am an IT project management consultant, church musician, and project management instructor at UMass Boston.  Erik is an outdoor experiential education specialist.  Reema is a freshman at Roxbury Community College.  Rusty is a happy dog.

neighborhood_overview: Roslindale is an up and coming neighborhood next door to Jamaica Plain, West Roxbury,   Brookline, and the 265-acre Arnold Arboretum.  The list of great restaurants in the square includes Birch Street Bistro, Delfino, 753 South, Shanti, and Sophia's Grotto.  Napper Tandy's is an Irish pub with reasonably-priced beer, excellent comfort food, and a pool hall.  Fornax is an amazing bakery, Effie's Kitchen Gyro is the place for Greek fare, and Blue Star Restaurant serves breakfast and lunch.  There's also Village Market, a full-service grocery store, Family Dollar, and Target, Subway, and, of course, Dunkin' Donuts.  All are easy walks from our home as are many other shops, salons, and stores, Bank of America, and the Boston School of English.
notes: We welcome guests with well-socialized canine companions. Parking may be available in our driveway, and there is almost always safe street parking on Poplar and Florence Streets. Smoking is allowed outside.
transit: The Roslindale Village Commuter Rail station (Needham Line) is a five-minute walk from the house, maybe six or seven minutes if you don't catch the lights right at Washington Street.  Buses to and from Forrest Hills T Station are a one-minute walk.  You can catch multiple buses to and from Forrest Hills, including the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and 51.
access: You will also have access to the living room, dining room, and kitchen on the first floor, and the second-floor laundry room.
interaction: We are friendly and outgoing, and and will help you in any way that we can, but we will also give you your space.

host_name: Ken, Reema, Erik, Jim, And Rusty!
host_about:
We are a modern, chosen family consisting of me and my partners, Jim and Erik, Reema, the daughter of a guyanese friend, and canine ambassador, Rusty, our little five-year-old chihuahua/pomeranian rescue dog.  

We are all looking forward to sharing our home on AirBNB.  Jim is a clinical psychologist who works primarily with people with Autism Spectrum Disorder.  I am an IT project management consultant, church musician, and project management instructor at UMass Boston.  Erik is an outdoor experiential education specialist.  Reema is a freshman at Roxbury Community College.  Rusty is a happy dog.

name: Retreat into Beauty, Peace, and Light
summary: A quiet enclave, our home is ideal for the traveler who likes calm and peace. When you look at the backyard, you may feel that you are in the middle of a forest, surrounded by birds and squirrels. Furnished with culture and elegance, your bedroom gets lots of natural lighting and invites you to relax. It has central AC and off-street parking.
space: Art, knick knacks, and furniture represent North American, East Asian, South Asian, and Mediterranean cultures. The attention to detail and comfort create a setting where you can make yourself at home.
description: A quiet enclave, our home is ideal for the traveler who likes calm and peace. Art, knick knacks, and furniture represent North American, East Asian, South Asian, and Mediterranean cultures. The attention to detail and comfort create a setting where you can make yourself at home. Guest will be able to access first floor kitchen, first floor half bath, and second floor bath. A residential sanctuary, our street attracts families and has low traffic. The neighborhood is called Roslindale. The 'dale' refers to the many hills. The terrain resembles that of Roslin, a village near Edinburgh in Scotland. All the houses on our street are one or two stories. Architecture is predominantly Colonial Revival,  reflective of 1950's and 196
neighborhood_overview: A residential sanctuary, our street attracts families and has low traffic. The neighborhood is called Roslindale. The 'dale' refers to the many hills. The terrain resembles that of Roslin, a village near Edinburgh in Scotland. All the houses on our street are one or two stories. Architecture is predominantly Colonial Revival,  reflective of 1950's and 1960's New England middle class. Please read the "Getting around" section for more information on the location.
notes: The room is suitable for 1 person as there is a single twin bed. However, we can bring in a futon if there are 2 people.
transit: There's ample parking available on the street.  If you're taking public transportation, the closest train station is at Hyde Park, which is 1.2 miles away, the closest bus stop is at Poplar St@Beech St, which is 0.3 miles away, and the closest subway station is Forest Hills, which is 2.5 miles away.  -Lyft or Uber to/from train stations (Hyde Park, Fairmount, or Forest Hills), is typically $4-$12 -Lyft or Uber to/from Airport is typically $18-$50 depending on traffic  -5-minute walk to MBTA bus #50, which runs every 20 to 30 minutes during weekday morning and afternoon peak hours and once per hour during non-peak.  -Especially during evenings and weekends, public transportation is inconvenient.  -1 mile walk to MBTA Bus #32 or #34 -1/2 mile to George Wright Golf Course -1.2 mile to Cleary Square -1.5 miles to Roslindale Village -2 miles to the Arnold Arboretum -3 miles to Forest Hills MBTA Station -6 miles to Fenway and Longwood Medical Area -8 miles to Back Bay -12 miles to Logan Airp

If you are using a lot of toilet paper, please use the trash can next to the toilet. -No visitors.

My interests are: Slacklining (walking tightropes), beach-volleyball, playing music, cooking, yoga, long boarding, dance,  ultimate frisbee, playing board games/improv games, cycling, handstands! Lots and lots of handstands!!

name: Cozy quirky home away from home
summary: Charming, urban country home welcomes you. We are two friends, LGBTQ professionals in our 40s, one Boston native & one from AR, sharing a big hundred year old house in a quiet, residential neighborhood. The space is a well-lit upstairs room facing the garden with closet & built-in shelves, a comfy twin day bed & trundle bed for an extra guest. It's homey but not fancy, and you'll share the rest of the house with us. We love to host longer-term guests and members of our community!
space: We have 3 friendly cats, a 3 season porch, two fireplaces, ample sunshine, lovely small back deck for nice weather, & a big yard full of nature.

name: Enjoy your (whip)Trip in Boston (Whipple Ave)!
summary: Warm and welcoming home in Boston! Walking distance to the Arboretum and Roslindale Village - with eclectic shops, tasty restaurants, beer gardens and breweries, and our famous Saturday market. Quick and easy access (less than 20 minutes) to the heart of Boston via the Orange Line (subway) or by walking/biking through the Emerald Necklace or the GreenWay! Private parking spot onsite - with an Enterprise Rental Car depot around the corner. This is where you want to be in Boston!
space: Warm and welcoming home in Boston! We hav soft foam mattresses and comfortable furniture in the bedrooms and community spaces. We have a private bathroom for your stay and everything you need in the kitchen for a home-cooked meal. This is where you want to be in Boston!

You'll have access to the fully-furnished condo including your private bedroom and bathroom, community area, kitchen, and entertainment / office space on the lower-level. I'll be available to get you set up with internet and ensure you feel at ho
neighborhood_overview: Roslindale is an amazing neighborhood in the southwest part of the city. The famous Arboretum (a dynamic park) is a short walk from the condo. We are also walking distance to the Roslindale Village - the central hub of the neighborhood with diverse restaurants (e.g., American, Bar Food, Chinese, Greasy Spoon Diner, Japanese, Indian,  Italian, and more). We have coffeeshops, Irish Pubs, supermarkets, and a Saturday Farmer's Market! Of course, we are located a short distance from the Orange Line (subway - Forest Hills). It is walkable or you can take multiple busses - only a 6 minute ride - to the station!
notes: NA
transit: We are located a short distance from the Orange Line (subway - Forest Hills). It is walkable or you can take multiple busses - only a 6 minute ride - to the station!  No need for street parking - We have a parking space waiting for you!  For those who need a car after you arrive, an Enterprise Rental Car depot is around the corner.
access: You'll have access to the fully-furnished condo including your private bedroom and bathroom, community area, kitchen, and entertainment / office space on the lower-level.
interaction: I'll be available to get you set up with internet and ensure you feel at home. I can also provide Airport / train station pick-ups / drop-offs for a nominal additional charge.
house_rules: - The condo community respects quieter hours from 10pm - 8am
host_about: I am an educator and entrepreneur.  In both capacities I focus on leadership development, community building, and reflection initiatives.

name: Mi casa es su casa.
summary: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).  A clean space you can relax in and entertain yourself with the trinkets we've collected and placed thoughtfully throughout our home. We are conveniently located on a street that ends into the Harvard Arboretum on one end and has the Roslindale Village Commuter Rail at the other with a short cut path into Roslindale Village for shops and dining.

summary: Single family home with small room in my home. Dresser and full size bed. This is ideal for solo travel or couple.
space: Think of the space as a cozy warm room in your friends house. Its a warm and inviting home with access to the common areas and the back deck/yard which is the best part. Come enjoy the great outdoor space in Roslindale.. a gem in the city.

You will have full access to all common rooms, Kitchen, family room, back yard. A beautiful new deck and grill. Perfect spot for morning coffee or quiet dinner. name: Bright and Cozy Private Room
summary: Quiet, sunny, safe private room in a colorful three bedroom in beautiful Roslindale. Five minute walk to local bus line and commuter rail (15 mins into Boston) -- Needham Line MBTA. Walking distance to grocery store  (Roche Brothers), shops, restaurants and a 10 minute ride to Jamaica Plain or 25 minutes via car to Boston.
space: Colorful, bright, eclectic three bedroom. One bedroom with a queen bed, and another kid's room available for rent. Small back yard space for enjoying the outdoors and plenty to do in the area.
description: Quiet, sunny, safe private room in a colorful three bedroom in beautiful Roslindale. Five minute walk to local bus line and commuter rail (15 mins into Boston) -- Needham Line MBTA. Walking distance to grocery store  (Roche Brothers), shops, restaurants and a 10 minute ride to Jamaica Plain or 25 minutes via car to Boston. Colorful, bright, eclectic three bedroom. One bedroom with a queen bed, and another kid's room available for rent. Small back yard space for enjoying the outdoors and plenty to do in the area. Guests are open to use all common and rented bedroom space. I am available at all times, and live onsite so I will be available to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Roslindale is a quaint, safe and beautiful neighborhood of Boston. A short walk two blocks from the house allows you to see the Boston skyline. The house is close to the local bus (36, 35, 37 to Forest Hills) and Needham Line commuter rail. Orange line stop at Forest Hills is a 7 to 10 minute ride. I am Bosto

notes: I am Boston-born and an artist. I am happy to provide recommendations of things to do in and around Boston. I am also a cook, make my own pasta and bread and usually bake something up for my guests' arrival. I have a small child who stays with me half the time, but is quiet and respectful.

Roslindale is an awesome town located in Boston proper with easy access to downtown Boston.  Roslindale could be the real-life inspiration for “Cheers,” the barroom-based television show where everybody knows your name. neighborhood_overview: Keep Roslindale Quirky is the town slogan.  Roslindale is an awesome town located in Boston proper with easy access to downtown Boston.  Roslindale could be the real-life inspiration for “Cheers,” the barroom-based television show where everybody knows your name. Celebrated for its homegrown businesses, local organizations, and community wide block parties, Roslindale cultivates neighborhood ties. It appears that Roslindale has it all, unless you’re looking for fast-paced or late-night entertainment. When bright lights and big buildings are what you seek, catch a ride into the city on the bus or commuter rail.
notes: NA
transit: Roslindale is an awesome town located in Boston proper with easy access to downtown Boston via Commuter rail (15 minute walk and 18 minute ride into Boston) or bus, Uber, etc. Driving is very easy where we live and there is lots of street parking around.
